alert.note: Alert for Carson; Gray; Hansford; Hemphill; Hutchinson; Lipscomb; Ochiltree; Roberts; Wheeler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Lipscomb, northern Wheeler, northern Carson, Hutchinson, northern Gray, southern Hansford, Roberts, western Hemphill and southern Ochiltree Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1029 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles west of Stinnett to 10 miles north of Skellytown to 3 miles northeast of Lora. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pampa, Borger, Spearman, Canadian, Miami, Fritch, Stinnett, Briscoe, Wheeler, Lefors, Skellytown, Sanford, Wolf Creek Park, New Mobeetie, Pringle, Morse, Lora, Kingsmill, Codman, and Mobeetie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for the Panhandle of Texas.

area.areaDesc: Carson; Gray; Hansford; Hemphill; Hutchinson; Lipscomb; Ochiltree; Roberts; Wheeler
